sections.canonical_section_name: Chicago Department of Finance (Parking, Red Light & ASE)
sections.authority_name: City of Chicago Department of Finance

serves.description: Processes most parking, red light and automated speed enforcement citations issued within the City of Chicago.

how_to_recognize.notes: City of Chicago parking and camera citations display a 10-digit Notice Number, which must be used to contest or pay the citation【830560214250021†L190-L210】.

method_constraints: Initial Review request must be submitted within 21 days of issuance or 14 days from first notice
submission_methods.notes: The City of Chicago allows contesting a citation by mail, through the e-hearing system, via telephone or in person; mailing address must be confirmed due to restricted access to contest-by-mail page.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: The official ‘Contest by Mail’ address could not be confirmed because the City of Chicago’s contest-by-mail webpage is restricted; a mailing address must be verified by calling the ticket help line.

confirm_by_phone.department: City of Chicago Ticket Help Line
confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm the correct mailing address for submitting an Initial Review (phase‑1) of a parking citation.

verification.verified_source_note: City of Chicago eHearing and payment plan FAQs provide the 10-digit Notice Number requirement but do not list a mailing address; the contest-by-mail page is restricted, so the mailing address must be confirmed by phone.

serves.description: Parking citations issued by Chicago Police Department officers.

how_to_recognize.notes: CPD citations generally use the same 10‑digit Notice Number format used by the Department of Finance; confirmation is required.

submission_methods.notes: Chicago Police Department citations are processed by the Department of Finance; appeals follow the same methods as DOF-issued citations.

confirm_by_phone.department: City of Chicago Ticket Help Line
confirm_by_phone.purpose: Verify that CPD-issued parking citations route to the Department of Finance for phase‑1 appeals.

verification.verified_source_note: Need to confirm whether all CPD-issued parking citations route to the Department of Finance for contest by mail.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on University of Chicago campus property.

how_to_recognize.notes: Citation numbers typically consist of 6–8 digits; actual format may vary and should be verified with the Parking Office.

method_constraints: Appeal must be submitted through the University of Chicago citation appeal form
submission_methods.notes: The University of Chicago requires all parking citation appeals to be submitted via an online form; mail and in-person appeals are not accepted【204877253871098†L131-L135】.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: University of Chicago’s parking services website specifies an online appeal process only and does not provide a mailing address for appeals.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm whether any mail-in appeal option exists and obtain the correct mailing address if available【240516410830649†L152-L154】.

verification.verified_source_note: The University of Chicago parking regulations page states that citations can be contested through a citation appeal form and lists a contact phone number but no mailing address【204877253871098†L131-L135】【240516410830649†L152-L154】.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on University of Illinois at Chicago campus property.

how_to_recognize.notes: UIC citation numbers are typically numeric and may vary by length; actual format should be verified with Campus Parking Services.

submission_methods.notes: Appeals may be submitted online or by mail; in-person appeals are not offered【344224926271568†L118-L143】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Verify that this is the correct mailing address for submitting a UIC parking citation appeal and confirm any citation number format【344224926271568†L118-L143】【344224926271568†L242-L247】.

verification.verified_source_note: UIC appeals page instructs mailing appeal forms to Campus Parking Services/Attention Appeals and lists the contact address and phone number【344224926271568†L118-L143】【344224926271568†L242-L247】.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on Loyola University Chicago campus property.

how_to_recognize.notes: Citation numbers vary and are typically numeric; actual format should be confirmed with campus parking services.

method_constraints: Appeal must be submitted through park.luc.edu
submission_methods.notes: Loyola University Chicago requires that ticket appeals be submitted online; paper, email or in‑person appeals are not accepted【194675584378476†L121-L136】.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: Loyola University Chicago only accepts appeals through its online portal and does not provide a mailing address for appeals【194675584378476†L121-L136】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Verify whether any mail-in appeal option exists and confirm citation number format【194675584378476†L121-L136】.

verification.verified_source_note: Loyola University Chicago’s ticket appeals page states that all appeals must be submitted online and provides a contact phone number; no mailing address for appeals is listed【194675584378476†L121-L136】.

serves.description: Parking citations issued on Northwestern University’s Chicago campus.

how_to_recognize.notes: Citation numbers are typically numeric and must be entered when contesting; exact format should be confirmed with the campus parking office.

method_constraints: Appeals must be submitted through Northwestern’s online portal within 10 days of citation
submission_methods.notes: Northwestern University requires that Chicago campus parking citation appeals be submitted via an online portal; mail is only accepted for payments【878244850982906†L185-L243】.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: Northwestern University’s Chicago campus parking page specifies that appeals must be submitted online; no mailing address is provided for appeals【878244850982906†L185-L243】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Confirm whether any mail-in appeal option exists and verify citation number format【878244850982906†L185-L243】.

verification.verified_source_note: Northwestern University’s Chicago campus parking page notes that ticket appeals must be submitted through an online portal and provides a phone number; no mailing address for appeals is listed【878244850982906†L185-L243】.

sections.canonical_section_name: Illinois Institute of Technology Parking Services

serves.description: Parking citations issued on Illinois Institute of Technology’s campus.

how_to_recognize.notes: Citation numbers are typically numeric; actual format should be verified with the Campus Business Services Center.

method_constraints: Appeals must be submitted via email within seven days of citation
submission_methods.notes: Illinois Tech requires appeals to be submitted by email to campusbusiness@illinoistech.edu within seven days; appeals cannot be resolved by phone or in person【388031941235416†L177-L187】.

appeal_mail_to.missing_reason: Illinois Institute of Technology directs appellants to email their appeal; no mailing address is provided for citation appeals【388031941235416†L177-L187】.

confirm_by_phone.purpose: Verify whether a mail appeal address exists and confirm citation number format【43642007707368†L126-L127】.

verification.verified_source_note: Illinois Tech’s appeal policy page states that appeals must be submitted via email within seven days and cannot be resolved by phone or in person; contact phone for general parking services is provided on the service parking page【388031941235416†L177-L187】【43642007707368†L126-L127】.

blocking_issues: City of Chicago contest-by-mail address remains unverified due to restricted website access.
Routing of Chicago Police Department citations to the Department of Finance requires confirmation.
known_gaps: Missing mailing addresses for University of Chicago, Loyola University Chicago, Northwestern University, and Illinois Institute of Technology due to online-only appeal procedures.
Potential additional issuing authorities (such as Chicago airports or park districts) were not identified because of limited publicly available information.
